title: Our Lady of Lourdes graduates 168
content: CLOSE       The 168 graduates hail from 15 different school districts throughout Dutchess, Orange, Ulster, Putnam, and Columbia counties. Nina Schutzman, Poughkeepsie Journal        Buy Photo   Our Lady of Lourdes High School class of 2018 waits for graduation to begin on June 2, 2018. The private Catholic school is located in the Town of Poughkeepsie. (Photo: Nina Schutzman/Poughkeepsie Journal) Buy Photo      In a few months, Our Lady of Lourdes High School's latest graduates will be spread out across the country.    They'll head to Princeton University in New Jersey, or Boston College, or Georgia Tech. Some will stay close to home at Vassar College in Poughkeepsie or Mount Saint Mary College in Newburgh. Three will serve in the military.    But all will remember their time at the Town of Poughkeepsie-based private Catholic school.    VASSAR: College graduation celebrates differences of Vassar's class of 2018    FIREFIGHTERS: Dutchess volunteer firefighters graduate from training    CEREMONY: Ridley-Lowell grads will get ceremony despite school closure        Autoplay    Show Thumbnails    Show Captions    Last Slide Next Slide     Nearly 1,500 loved ones and well-wishers packed the Arts and Athletic Center on Saturday morning to celebrate with the class of 2018 at Lourdes' 57th commencement ceremony.    "They're probably one of the smartest, the brightest, the most energetic, creative class of students I've seen in a really long time," said Lourdes Principal Catherine Merryman. "They are talented and kind and I really believe they are going to do great things."    The 168 graduates hail from 15 different school districts throughout Dutchess, Orange, Ulster, Putnam, and Columbia counties, according to Lourdes.    Nearly all of them are going to college, and they've been granted a combined $40 million in college scholarships.         CLOSE       Courteney Mattison will attend NYU, where she plans to study biomolecular science and dance. Nina Schutzman, Poughkeepsie Journal       Among the graduates of Our Lady of Lourdes class of 2018:    ♦ Six are National Merit Commended Students and one is a National Hispanic Recognition Program Scholar    ♦  85 are members of the National Honor Society.    ♦ 18 are National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) committed athletes.    ♦ 82 percent were accepted to their first choice colleges.    Valedictorian Anna Gregory is off to the University of Notre Dame, where she will double major in economics and business analytics.    Salutatorian Joseph Scaglione will attend Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute, where he will major in major mechanical engineering and play football.     Nina Schutzman: nschutzman@poughkeepsiejournal.com, 845-451-4518 Twitter: @pojonschutzman        CLOSE       Our Lady of Lourdes High School graduate Mathew Baldwin will head to Marist College, possibly Cornell University Nina Schutzman, Poughkeepsie Journal       Buy Photo   Our Lady of Lourdes High School class of 2018 waits for graduation to begin on June 2, 2018.
